questions.question: How would you best describe your diet?
In a week, how much do you spend on food from restaurants, canteens and takeaways?
Of the food you buy, how much is wasted and thrown away?
How often do you buy locally produced food that is not imported to Kenya?
options: A lot of the food I buy is locally sourced
Some of the food I buy is locally sourced
I don't worry about where my food comes from

questions.question: What kind of vehicle do you travel in most often as driver or passenger?
questions.hint: This question is finding out about your private car/motorbike use. We'll ask about public transport next. If you walk or cycle everywhere, just click 'Neither'.
options: Neither - I walk, cycle, or use public transport for all my journeys

questions.question: How many hours a week do you spend on the train for personal use including commuting?
questions.hint: This should include your commute and any other train journeys you make, except business trips (they're part of your employer's footprint, not yours).

questions.question: How many hours a week do you spend on the bus for personal use including commuting?
questions.hint: This should include your commute and any other bus journeys you make, except business trips (they're part of your employer's footprint, not yours).

questions.question: In the last year, how many return flights have you made in total to the following locations?
questions.hint: This should not include business trips (they're part of your employer's footprint, not yours). Leave blank if not applicable.

questions.question: What percentage of your flights do you offset?
What kind of house do you live in?
How many bedrooms does your house have?
How many people (aged 17 and over) live in your house?
How do you heat your home?
questions.hint: Please indicate the primary fuel source that is used. Your energy bill will tell you this.

questions.question: Is your electricity on a green tariff?
questions.hint: Your tariff is the energy plan you're on. If your electricity is from renewable generation, it will be indicated on your bill.
options: Yes but the tariff is less than 100% renewables

questions.question: Do you regularly turn off lights and not leave your appliances on standby?
How warm do you keep your home in winter?
Which of these home energy efficiency improvements are installed in your home?
questions.hint: Select all that apply or leave blank if not applicable.
options: Low flow fittings to taps and showers

questions.question: In the last 12 months, have you bought any of these new household items?
questions.hint: Select all that apply or leave blank if not applicable. Don't include any second-hand items, just those you bought new.
options: Washing machine, dishwasher, tumble dryer, or fridge freezer

questions.question: In a typical month, how much do you spend on clothes and footwear?
questions.hint: Don't include second-hand clothes, just those you bought new.

questions.question: In a typical month, how much do you spend on your pets and pet food?
questions.hint: This includes pet food, vet and grooming products, kennels, cages, litter, etc.

questions.question: In a typical month, how much do you spend on health, beauty, and grooming products?
In a typical month, how much do you spend on phone, internet, and TV contracts?
In a typical month, how much do you spend on entertainment and hobbies (sports/gym, cinema, books, newspapers, gardening, computer games)?
Which of these types of waste do you recycle and/or compost?
questions.hint: Select all that apply or leave blank if not applicable.
